To my L. Treasuro
r
N
o
19. 90

page.lettertext:
fol.327r
Belgia: 1590: No
v
:
1590 19 Novem
b
To my L. Trea
s
May yt please yo
r
L. The pensyoner of whose name I
advertised yo
r
L. the 28 of Oc
t
& the 2 of N
o
is returned
who bringeth word for certain that there is no innovation in either
of those two places that were spetially noted in
e plott that
I sent yo
u
, for hee hath employed a man of purpose, to take
a view of
e towne by whom he is infourmed, that
e fort onely
&
e wall adjoyning to it w
ch
is m
r
ked in
e forsaid platform
w
th
e l
re
M. w
ch
was also that place w
ch
was ment to bee attented
by those that failed of theyr purpose is better fortefied oth
r
wise
saving that
e oth
r
garrison is somewhat renforced they have altered
nothing in
e towne, Moreov
r
yt hath fallen out very
happely, that
e oth
r
tie that is of
Zeland
, w
th
whom the
pensyoner heer doth keep correspondence (as I have written
unto yo
u
in my former l
res
, hath bin lately in
Picardy
upon
occasyon of buisines & hath mett there by chaunce w
th
one of
his old acquaintance an Inhabitant at this present of
e
towne afore signified a man very resolute honest & religious
& one
t
is usually there employed about
e water workes
spetially those that ap
tain to
e passages through
e letter F.
this man
ceded so far in communication about
e state of that town
&
e weakenes therof in sondry places, that hee gave to
und
r
stand yf it were to
cure the lib
r
ty of his countrey, hee
would reveale asmuch as hee knew of c
r
tain commodious entrances
& would not refuse to hazard him self w
th
many
any
compaines that
should be sent by any prince to attempt the surprise, the
oth
r
notw
th
standing this insinuation made unto him by a spetiall
frend & one that liveth in
e towne it self thought yt not behooffull
as then to discover himself furder then in g
na
l termes, so that then
they de
ted affected both alike, & not resolving up
o
any thing
never the les hee of Zeland doth build very much up
o
the good
inclincation of
e sayd
ty, & up
o
his meanes to advance the
enterprise for the w
ch
he hath sent mee word by
e Pensyoner
that er yt be long he will be w
th
me at
e
Hage
to confer of
the matter, & if I shall think yt good he will make a voyage
of purpose into Picardy, & send for his friend to come theth
r
unto
him, w
th
whom he will enter into farder practise as I shall
advise him. Upon this offer I do attend his coming, & th
r
after
as his remonstrance is unto me shall cary
bability I will
urge him to go seek his friend
to work so effectually w
th
him as
he may be Interessed in
e action, I cannot write of this matter
so plainely as I would, albeit it bee plainer then I would
willingly adventure yf I had a cypher, w
ch
I trust yo
r
L. yf
you find yt needfull will send w
th
e soonest, howbeyt for
mine owne indevor in this matter I hope to deale in such sort as
either
t
w
ch
is intended shalbee thorowly effected, or nothing
und
r
taken to her
Ma
ties
prejudice
& so &c. No
v
1590.
